forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. West southwest wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 13 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
As darkness envelops Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a cool whisper, suggesting the familiar embrace of the marine layer. Tonight, the city sits mostly shrouded in clouds, with a gentle breeze teasing through the streets at a steady pace, reminding all of summer’s delicate transition into the cooler embrace of evening. The temperature, hovering around a mild 53 degrees, invites a light jacket, perhaps one that can withstand a whispering wind gusting playfully up to 23 miles per hour. 

In the morning, the fog will retreat, allowing the sun to cast its soft warmth across the cityscape. Expect a pleasant rise in the daytime temperature to about 62 degrees, with the afternoon drawing in a drop toward 60, as the winds dance a bit more vigorously. The day’s clarity will encourage leisurely strolls along the waterfront, where the sights of sailboats can be admired against the backdrop of the iconic Golden Gate Bridge, and art-filled corners of the Mission District await exploration. Dressing in layers is prudent; a comfortable blend of light fabrics beneath a slightly heavier top will serve well against the cool breezes as you savor the city’s unfolding beauty in the mellow warmth of the sun.
